abstract.text: Asynchronously loads a Live Photo from the specified resource files.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: An array of URLs containing only the still URL and the video URL that constitute a Live Photo, as obtained using the
class.
A static image to represent the Live Photo before its full content has been loaded and validated.
The target size of Live Photo to be returned. Pass
to obtain the requested Live Photo at its original size.
An option for how to fit the image to the aspect ratio of the requested size. For details, see
A block to be called when image loading is complete, providing the requested Live Photo or information about the status of the request.
The block takes the following parameters:
The requested Live Photo object.
result
A dictionary providing information about the status of the request. See
for possible keys and values.
info
A numeric identifier for the request. If you need to cancel the request before it completes, pass this identifier to the
method.
Use this method to load Live Photo objects for display from data files previously exported from a Photos library. For example, a social networking app can use the

class to retrieve the data files that constitute a Live Photo in one user’s library and upload them to a server. Then, on another user’s device, the app downloads those data files and uses this method to re-create a Live Photo object for display using the
class.
To instead obtain a
object representing a Live Photo asset from the user’s Photos library, use the
class to locate the asset and the
class to fetch the asset’s Live Photo data for display.
To instead import a Live Photo to the Photos library, use the
class.
This method is asynchronous. Photos loads, validates, and prepares data on a background thread, then calls your

block with a ready-to-display Live Photo object. Like the similar methods in the PHImageManager class, Photos can call your result handler block more than once—first, to provide a low-quality Live Photo object (consisting of only the static image from the
parameter), then later to provide the full motion and sound content of the Live Photo. If the
value in your result handler’s
dictionary is
, Photos will call your result handler again.
This method can load a

object only from the same set of files exported from a previously captured Live Photo asset. When you use this method, Photos validates that the files and their metadata can be loaded as a Live Photo. If Photos cannot load a Live Photo from the specified files, the
parameter in your result handler block is
, and the
dictionary contains an
object describing the error.

abstract.text: Work with image and video assets that the Photos app manages, including those from iCloud Photos and Live Photos.
A representation of an image, video, or Live Photo in the Photos library.
A request to create a new Photos asset from underlying data resources, for use in a photo library change block.
An underlying data resource associated with a photo, video, or Live Photo asset in the Photos library.
Options for fitting an image’s aspect ratio to a requested size, used by the
method.
An object that facilitates retrieving or generating preview thumbnails and asset data.
Requests an image representation for the specified asset.
A displayable representation of a Live Photo—a picture that includes motion and sound from the moments just before and after its capture.
Cancels an asynchronous request
Asynchronously loads a Live Photo from the specified resource files.
A Boolean (
) value indicating whether the result Live Photo is a low-quality substitute for the requested Live Photo.
A numeric identifier for an asynchronous Live Photo loading request.
A view that displays a Live Photo—a picture that also includes motion and sound from the moments just before and after its capture.
A structure that contains width and height values.
An object representing a static collection of key-value pairs, for use instead of a  constant in cases that require reference semantics.
A high-level interface for manipulating image data.
An object that manages image data in your app.
A value that identifies the location of a resource, such as an item on a remote server or the path to a local file.
A type-erased hashable value.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.

value.text: A static collection of objects associated with unique keys.
